content: I am trying to figure out if I should start planning to join the national guard and the only question I have left is if my vision does or doesn't meet the requirements to join. My corrected vision is 20/20 in my right and 20/60 in my left. My specialty will probably be combat arms. Could someone please tell me if I am eligible for that and if not am I eligible for any of the other specalities? Thanks

title: EYESIGHT IN THE NATIONAL GUARD

title: EYESIGHT IN THE NATIONAL GUARD

content: Rob- Dial back the attitude. Understand. From AR 40-501(Standards of Medical Fitness)Chapter 2-13 Vision: 2–13. Vision a. Current distant visual acuity of any degree that does not correct with spectacle lenses to at least one of the following (367) is disqualifying: (1) 20/40 in one eye and 20/70 in the other eye. (2) 20/30 in one eye and 20/100 in the other eye. (3) 20/20 in one eye and 20/400 in the other eye. Regulations are clear. Talk to a recruiter. Good luck.
reply: Rob- Dial back the attitude. Understand. From AR 40-501(Standards of Medical Fitness)Chapter 2-13 Vision: 2–13. Vision a.
